user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of process_param__medium:
```c
static enum PerfRepl_param_result
process_param__medium (const char *param_name)
{
  if (tool_params.empty)
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "Parameter '%s' cannot be used together "
             "with '-E' or '--empty'.\n", param_name);
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
  }
  if (tool_params.tiny)
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "Parameter '%s' cannot be used together "
             "with '-T' or '--tiny'.\n", param_name);
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
  }
  if (tool_params.large)
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "Parameter '%s' cannot be used together "
             "with '-L' or '--large'.\n", param_name);
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
  }
  tool_params.medium = ! 0;
  return '-' == param_name[1] ?
         PERF_RPL_PARAM_FULL_STR :PERF_RPL_PARAM_ONE_CHAR;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (tool_params.tiny)
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "Parameter '%s' cannot be used together "
             "with '-T' or '--tiny'.\n", param_name);
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
  }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the 'if (tool_params.tiny) { ... return ...; }' block is reachable at run-time whenever tool_params.tiny evaluates to true. There is no evidence in the fragment that tool_params.tiny is a compile‑time constant or that the condition can never be true, so this does not constitute unreachable code. (A violation would only occur if tool_params.tiny were provably always false at compile time, making the entire block dead code.)
